Relationships    - Sub-part of (A part can be part of another part, forming a hierarchy)    - Composed of (A part can be composed of smaller parts)    - Belongs to (A part belongs to a larger whole)    - Connects with (Some parts connect with others to function together)5. Classes    - Abstract Part Class    - Physical Part Class    - Temporal Part Class    - Spatial Part Class6. Constraints    - A part can never be larger than the whole it is part of    - A part must always belong to a whole    - Part dependencies (one part may rely on another to function)    7. Functions    - Division (The act of breaking down a larger whole into parts)    - Aggregation (The act of combining parts into a whole)    - Replacement (The act of removing one part and installing another)    - Repair (The act of fixing a damaged part)8. Axioms    - Transitivity of Part (If A is part of B, and B is part of C, then A is part of C)    - The whole is greater than any of its parts.
